poem:
### Echoes in Villa de Etla

In the prison's echo,  
motivation whispers—  
"Live and let live"—  
as trees fall silent.  
  
Pablo's hands,  
unbound in protest,  
now trace guiltless shadows  
on grey walls.  
  
Outside,  
roots remember.  
In whispers of leave,  
"First things first"—  
justice pressing  
through bars,  
beyond leaves.
